context_evidences: - Critics jumped on Dorsey for supporting Chick-fil-A during the month of June, which is Pride Month for the LGBTQ (lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, questioning) community. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/nation-now/2018/06/11/twitter-jack-dorsey-chick-fil-pride/691298002/ published on 2018-06-11 00:00:00

- Rodney Bullard, executive director of the Chick-fil-A Foundation, spoke at a conference at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce Foundation last week about one program: The Westside Future Fund , a nonprofit aimed at revitalizing Atlanta’s Westside neighborhood. When asked about Cathy’s remarks in a Nov. 15 interview, Bullard said Chick-fil-A has never had a policy against the LGBT community. Reference: https://morningconsult.com/2017/11/20/with-chick-fil-a-consumers-separate-food-from-social-issues/ published on 2017-11-20 17:00:58

- Dorsey acknowledged the situation after former CNN host Soledad O’Brien tweeted :"This is an interesting company to boost during Pride month, @jack." Dorsey responded in a tweet: “You’re right. Completley forgot about their background.” Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/nation-now/2018/06/11/twitter-jack-dorsey-chick-fil-pride/691298002/ published on 2018-06-11 00:00:00

- And yet millennials are less likely to view Chick-fil-A’s community influence negatively compared to McDonald’s and other fast-food chains. Ten percent of millennials say Chick-fil-A has a negative impact on their community, while 53 percent say it has a positive one. Reference: https://morningconsult.com/2017/11/20/with-chick-fil-a-consumers-separate-food-from-social-issues/ published on 2017-11-20 17:00:58
correction_response:
This tweet is potentially misleading. While Chick-fil-A's CEO did express opposition to same-sex marriage in 2012 and the company donated to anti-gay groups, their public stance seems to have evolved. The tweet from Chick-fil-A, Inc. suggests inclusivity, stating their food is for everyone, regardless of sexual orientation. However, it's important to note that some may view this as an attempt to improve their public image following the controversy. 
References: 
https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/nation-now/2018/06/11/twitter-jack-dorsey-chick-fil-pride/691298002/
https://morningconsult.com/2017/11/20/with-chick-fil-a-consumers-separate-food-from-social-issues/
note_1_text: The tweet shows a fake screenshot, which has been altered to show Chick-Fil-A's twitter profile with LGBTQ colors.     Looking at their real profile it is clear that such is not the case.     https://twitter.com/ChickfilA
note_2_text: The screenshot is digitally altered to show pride colors and lgbt stuff but their actual Twitter profile does not
queries:
1. Chick-fil-A's stance on LGBTQ+ community
2. Chick-fil-A's social media campaigns
3. Chick-fil-A's inclusivity policies
4. Chick-fil-A's Chick-n- MinisTM promotion
5. Chick-fil-A's Twitter post history
refute_evidences: - Chick-fil-A came under fire from gay rights supporters in 2012 because of comments made by the fast food chicken chain’s CEO, Dan Cathay, expressing opposition to same-sex marriage. The company had also donated millions to anti-gay groups. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/nation-now/2018/06/11/twitter-jack-dorsey-chick-fil-pride/691298002/ published on 2018-06-11 00:00:00

- Chick-fil-A’s public image was hit in 2012 after CEO Dan Cathy said he was opposed to same-sex marriage and as reports surfaced that the company donated to anti-gay charities, sparking protests. Cathy is a conservative Christian, as was his father, Chick-fil-A founder S. Truett Cathy. Reference: https://morningconsult.com/2017/11/20/with-chick-fil-a-consumers-separate-food-from-social-issues/ published on 2017-11-20 17:00:58

- "Dorsey's tweet reignited the debate. The backlash included comments like: “Why is Twitter boosting a notoriously anti-gay company during #PrideMonth” “Wow, I thought better of you @jack Way to support a homophobic company during Pride month .” “Did your meal come with a side-order of homophonic bigotry or did you pay extra for it?” Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/nation-now/2018/06/11/twitter-jack-dorsey-chick-fil-pride/691298002/ published on 2018-06-11 00:00:00

- Perceptions of community impact could also be credited to Chick-fil-A’s external charitable giving, which has shifted since the 2012 same-sex marriage controversy. That year, the chain started the Chick-fil-A Foundation, which has the broad focus of helping children succeed. Reference: https://morningconsult.com/2017/11/20/with-chick-fil-a-consumers-separate-food-from-social-issues/ published on 2017-11-20 17:00:58
tweet_category: Technology, Social Media, and Big Tech
tweet_image2text: A screenshot of Chick-fil-A's social media page on Twitter. The page bio reads "Chicken. Pride. Delivered." and provides a link to their careers page. The account, joined in August 2008, has 207.4K tweets, is following 7,198 accounts, and has 1.1M followers.

A screenshot of a post from Chick-fil-A, Inc., "We may disagree on certain things, but our warm and buttery Chick-n- MinisTM are for everyone! Gay, Straight, Man, Woman-We can all Eat Mor Chikin!" The post was accompanied by a GIF of chicken nuggets on a rainbow background.
